trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class creates a TCP/IP or UDP LDAP connection to Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services or an LDAP server.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection> object and <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.QueryClientCertificate%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions> object are both set, the certificate specified in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property is ignored.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier.
The logon credentials and the Negotiate Authentication are used to connect to the LDAP server.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified server.
A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server.
Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the right end of the string by a colon (:).
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier,System.Net.NetworkCredential)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier and network credentials.
Negotiate Authentication is used.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> object that specifies the credentials to use.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier,System.Net.NetworkCredential,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier, network credentials, and authentication type.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> object that specifies the credentials to use.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType"></xref> values that specifies the type of authentication to use.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.
Thrown when authType is out of range.
Thrown when authType is specified as Anonymous but credential specified credentials.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Abort(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method cancels the asynchronous request.
A <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that references the asynchronous request.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Thrown if asyncResult was not returned by the corresponding call to
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType"></xref> property contains the supported authentication types.
A supported authentication type.
Thrown when authType is out of range.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AutoBind"></xref> property specifies whether an automatic bind is allowed.
`true` if the automatic bind is allowed; otherwise, `false`.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.BeginSendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method sends data asynchronously to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
A value from <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing"></xref> enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> function.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that references the asynchronous send.
The object handle is not valid.
request is `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Partial results are not supported.
A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to .

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.BeginSendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest,System.TimeSpan,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method sends data asynchronously to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The time, in seconds, until the request times out.
A value from <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing"></xref> enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> function.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that references the asynchronous send.
The object handle is not valid.
request is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Partial results are not supported.
A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to .

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Bind(System.Net.NetworkCredential)"></xref> method sends an LDAP bind using the specified <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> object that specifies the credentials to use.
The object handle is not valid.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.

Either the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates"></xref> property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType"></xref> property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Bind"></xref> method sends an LDAP bind using the current credentials.
The object handle is not valid.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to one of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error codes.

Either the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates"></xref> property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType"></xref> property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Credential"></xref> property contains the network credentials for the object.
The network credentials for the object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Dispose"></xref> method closes and releases the LDAP handle.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Dispose(System.Boolean)"></xref> method closes the connection and optionally releases the LDAP handle.
`true` if the handle is released when the connection is closed or `false` if the connection is closed without releasing the handle.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.EndSendRequest(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method completes an asynchronous request.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that contains state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the results of the request.
Thrown if the object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the call.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Finalize"></xref> method allows an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is reclaimed by garbage collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.GetPartialResults(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method retrieves partial results of an asynchronous operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that contains state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultsCollection"></xref> object that contains the partial results.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the call.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest)"></xref> method sends a single <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> as an LDAP v3 operation.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the response from the server.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest,System.TimeSpan)"></xref> method sends a single <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> as an LDAP v3 operation.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
The length of time, in seconds, until the request times out.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the response from the server.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.SessionOptions"></xref> property contains an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions"></xref> object that specifies the session options.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection> object and <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.QueryClientCertificate%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions> object are both set, the certificate specified in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property is ignored.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions"></xref> object that specifies the session options.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.Timeout"></xref> property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> times out.
The length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> times out.
